quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Val, I need the space.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.line: All right guys, clear out.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Everybody out.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.line: Promise me you're going to clean up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I can't promise what I'm going to do or not do.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.line: Promise me that-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Obviously I'm going to clean up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Stress is like the uptight mayor or a town who's saying, "Hey, we're uptight, you can't dance," and then you have to be like, "Oh yeah, Mayor Stress? Well watch this!" And then... we dance. Oh how we dance. [dances to Kenny Loggin's Footloose] Sex also works.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Hey! Jim's back from jury duty.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey! Tuna! He's back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh, look at this. [hugs Jim] Tuna wrap.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [grabs Jim's wrist] Hand roll.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: How was jury duty?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It was pretty uneventful, actually.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Can't believe they let someone like you serve on a jury. Makes me question the whole judicial system.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: What was the case?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uh, hit and run.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Ooh, "the case of the hit and run," that's exciting.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Did you send him to the slammer?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Nope. Not guilty.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Of course you found him not guilty. [mocking voice] "Oh, he apologized and I just really want him to like me, mm."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We're best friends, actually. We're going wine-tasting next weekend, if you want to come.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Not coming, have plans.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I did get called in to jury duty. And they released me around noon, so, didn't think it was worth it to come back to work for a half day. And then the next morning Pam was a little overwhelmed with the kids so I took an extra day to help out. And then three other days happened.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Ah! Angela had the baby!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Is it black? 'Cause that would be hilarious.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Why?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You know.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Would it be more hilarious than Angela having a Chinese baby?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: A little bit, yeah. Right guys? Back me up.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Eh, a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oh, did I win the pool?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Ah, no. Right month, wrong year.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Well no one won the pool. Angela wasn't due for another month.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: We should all go to the hospital and visit her.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, I'd love to but, um-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Aw man, I would but I can't miss any more work.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Well Kevin and I have to go, Accounting is its own little family.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah, Oscar's the dad, I'm Oscar's dad and Angela's my mom.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Everyone, our very own Angela-

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: We all got the email, some of us are going to go visit.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Oh, I am so in.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: I love maternity wards. It's the perfect blend of love and horror. Things can go so wrong or so right.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Come on, Judge Judy, tell us your case. What were the deets?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mine was actually a pretty boring case, so-

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: How could it be boring? You were there for five days. Titillate us.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Yeah, you owe us. I had to stay until six twice to cover for you. My wife got to the TV first, had to sit through damn Rizzoli and damn Isles.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yeah, my car got smashed visiting one of your clients and I had to have it detailed and they took my meter change.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow, I'm really sorry.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I never considered that my week off would make everyone else's job harder. The least I could do is give them a good story.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [demonstrating with napkin holder and salt shaker] So Phyllis, he was here, and then the car came and did- he was like that. Yeah, so it had to be a double backflip, actually.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: You know, when I was on j-duty, uh, Strangler case, we used to recreate the various stranglings with empanadas from- at Ernesto's.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh man, Ernesto's. That was our favorite restaurant too.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: You mean food truck. Ernesto's was a food truck.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Toby, shut your hole about the empanadas. Nobody cares about the empanadas.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I was in Los Angeles last year. Jim tricked me into thinking I'd won a walk-on part on NCIS, but that's not important. While I was being kicked off the lot, I saw food trucks everywhere. Everyone in Los Angeles eats from them. And nobody calls them restaurants.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [whispering] Guys, I don't know how many of you have seen- Gabe? Bring it in. I don't know how many of you have seen a premature baby before. It's going to be really tiny, so please don't say anything offensive.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Got that, bimbo?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Got it, bimbo. [Oscar knocks at the door]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Knock, knock. Oh!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Hi!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oh... I don't- I don't want any- what are you guys doing here?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: We wanted to say hi to the newest little Dunder Mifflinite.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.line: Well, meet our not-so-little bundle of joy, Philip Halsted Lipton.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Phillip is so fat.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Kevin!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You warned me not to say anything if it was tiny, Oscar. But you didn't prepare me for a big, giant, fat baby.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.line: Yes, he's substantial.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: He's more than substantial. He's a monster.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So this whole hit and run thing, there's just one part I can't figure out. You said it was at a four-way stop...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And the victim rode his bicycle into the left hand turn lane but the perp was already in the left-hand turn lane?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: See, that's what I'm having trouble with, because the fact is, you never said he was on a bicycle. [villainous laugh] Busted, Halpert!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, wait, wait.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes! Andy, get out here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No. I never said he was on a bicycle. I just said I wasn't listening to you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I am making a citizen's arrest. You have the right to remain silent. You have the right to beg for mercy. You have the right to request judgment by combat. Dwight's rights.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What's up, gangstas?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim was lying about jury duty. He was lying the whole time so he could go do yoga or go canoeing. I don't know what this pervert likes. Fire him!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Dwight, not everything is a conspiracy theory.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I have Jim on the record saying that the vic-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No. Dwight! I have me on the record, saying to you, take a chill pill.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I don't- I don't need to take a chill pill.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Here, right there. [mimes giving Dwight a pill and a glass] Down the hatch.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I really don't want to take the chill pill. [mimes taking pill]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Attaboy. Good. Now, chill.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, okay. [sits, exhales] But let's just say that Jim was lying about jury duty. You would have to fire him, right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, sure, of course. I'd fire him to Timbuktu. [Jim laughs nervously]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's good enough for me. [exhales again]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: ...and Pam was just going crazy, trying to take care of Philip because Cece has been out of control recently, and- look, Andy, it doesn't matter. The truth is, I just feel terrible lying to you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I feel terrible getting lied to. No one's ever lied to me before.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay. I think the best thing to do right now is just come clean and tell everybody the truth.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No, not after what I told Dwight about firing you. No. Here's what we're going to do. We're going to have ourselves a good old-fashioned cover-up. Have you ever heard of a Connecticut cover-up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Do you know why you never heard of it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Covered it up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Are you sure you can keep this under wraps?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: They used to call me King Tut because I'm so good at keeping things under wraps.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: My nickname was actually King Butt, because I had a king-size butt.

quotes.speaker: Ernesto
quotes.line: [pulls food truck up to where Dwight and Nate are standing] Where you want I park?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, everybody, gather 'round. Got a real special surprise for you. [indicates Ernesto and assistant who are carrying empanadas]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Ernesto!

quotes.speaker: Ernesto
quotes.line: Hola Toby! [mimes choking]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Yeah, hey.

quotes.speaker: Ernesto
quotes.line: Como esta? [speaks Spanish]

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.line: Uh, I'm going to say "I" when I'm talking for Ernesto, so instead of "he says blah, blah, blah," I'm going to say "I say, blah, blah, blah," but that's for him. Anyway, it was something like, "He remembers Toby." [makes face] "I remember Toby."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay- oh, Jim. Hey, this guy look familiar?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uh-

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: It's the empanada guy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: The empanada guy!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, Toby! [bleep] Damn it, Toby! No, I wasn't asking you. [sighs] Ask him if he remembers Jim. [Nate asks Ernesto a question in Spanish]

quotes.speaker: Ernesto
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.line: He says, "No."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: He says, "No!" Boom!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah but who remembers all their customers? I mean, I can name like three of our clients.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, he remembers Toby, the most forgettable man in the known world. [Ernesto says something in Spanish]

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.line: Ah, he doesn't want any trouble, he sees lots of people, they come from all around to eat his delicious meat pockets.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uh, you guys are going to love these. So, empanadas on me. You guys gotta try them.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Usually I'm a burrito guy, but if you won't tell, I won't. Wink, wink.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Great. And while we're enjoying these delicious empanadas, Jim, why don't you tell us your story again?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Why? Everybody's heard it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Walk us through it. What time would you get there every morning?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey, Murder She Wrote. How about we drop the whole 'Murder, She Wrote' thing, okay? Jim was at the courthouse for jury duty every morning. How do I know? Because I drove him there.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Why?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Why? Why? [looks at Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Because my car broke down.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: His car broke down. So he called me, 'cause I live near the courthouse.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wait, wait. You live by the courthouse. So you drove from near the courthouse, out to Jim's house, and then back to the courthouse?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Thirty minutes out, thirty minutes back, easy hour. And I would watch that cute little tushie scurry up those courthouse stairs every morning and that was that.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [to Ernesto] I'm sorry, do you have any American Mexican food?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: We're getting buried out there. What was that stuff about the car breaking down?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well, I think you handled it pretty well.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I'm not Rumpelstiltskin, Jim. I can't keep spinning gold out of your [bleep].

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, listen, all right? Dwight's on to us, he's going to figure it out really soon, so let's just get ahead of it, let's tell the truth.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [sighs] I don't even know what the truth is anymore.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Wow, it's so... healthy.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I'm going to call him Little Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, you will not.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Is he really five pounds?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Because I squat with five pounds. This- [squats, grunts] yeah, this feels like more than that.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.line: No, no, no, he's nine pounds, seven ounces.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Nine pounds? Really? I thought you said five. You know what? I was under so many drugs, I felt like I was at a James Taylor concert or something, oh. So, what did you bring?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Oh yeah, I don't know if it's right, but-

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.line: Well, if it's anything like that gorgeous wrapping paper, you hit it out of the park.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Aw, preemie pajamas!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Again, it may not be the right size. I can return-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, I think he came early just so he could wear these. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I got Little Kevin Call of Duty.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: This baby is clearly not premature. They're lying about the date it was conceived. It's very interesting. And her husband's gay. I don't even know which thread to follow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uh, excuse me, can I have everyone's attention for a second? First off, I just want to say that I'm really sorry, I didn't know that my absence last week would have been a burden on any of you, because, though I did have jury duty last week, they did dismiss me early on Monday. And I think you're going to find this pretty hilarious. I kind of, uh, well, maybe took the week off.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Funny? No? Nobody laughing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [laughs] You're screwed! Oh, it's happening. It's really happening.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: What the hell, Jim? I covered for your bony butt.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Pam really needed some help with the kids, so, I promise my intentions were good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Your clients. They're all mine.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Jim, I got my ass chewed out because one of your orders got messed up. And Andy, you said you drove him to the courthouse.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Uh, I did, every morning. And if I didn't, then I hope I die.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: All right, well. Let's get this show on the road, shall we? Allow me to give you a hand. [puts Jim's things in a box] Here we are. So long, clump-mate. I'm going to miss you. Truth be told, I never thought that this was how it was going to end. I always thought that I was going to defeat you somehow. But you've defeated yourself. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Dwight, cut it out. I'm not firing Jim.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, no, no. You said- you said that you were-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I know what I said. Jim, you're in deep doo-doo. Do you understand? I have one thing to say to you, and I'm going to say it in front of this whole office. Look me in the eye. [gives Jim a limp slap]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's it? This is crap! [dumps the box on Jim's desk and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: [on voicemail] You've reached Gabe Lewis, I'm currently indisposed. Leave me a message. Ciao. [beep]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Gabe, it's Dwight again. Highest priority, triple-urgent. Call me. Immediately. That means ASAP.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm gonna find Gabe, tell him what Jim did and let the little stickler do what he does best: stickle.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Shh.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Honestly, I can return this for a larger size.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It's fine. Pajamas aren't supposed to be baggy, right? It's not the barrio.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: The only premature baby in this room is the baby this baby ate.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Ah!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [giggles] Little Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Fine, God. Philip was conceived nine months ago.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I knew that, I knew it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: The senator and I wanted to wait, but we had just seen Thor and there was way too much wine in my chicken piccata.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Chicken marsala.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Right. Um, point is, Philip was conceived out of wedlock.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: And now you all know, but you can never tell. I'm serious.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Dwight. Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, hey. Have you seen Gabe?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: He went to the car or something, but he'll be back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay. [sits]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Don't you want to see the baby?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Psh! Why? I know what Angela and the senator look like. I can mash that up in my head right now.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I promised I wouldn't tell.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: So don't.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Angela got pregnant before the wedding.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: She got pregnant before the wedding.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: How long before?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: A month. [Dwight leaves, Oscar calls after him] You didn't hear it from me!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes I did.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.line: Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I want to see the baby.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh, Angela will make you cut your fingernails. It's not worth it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, yes. Oh, what a beautiful child. Prominent forehead, short arms, tiny nose. You will lead millions... [whispers] willingly, or as slaves.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That baby is a Schrute. And unless somebody taught Mose sex, that baby is mine.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: He's hungry.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.line: Oh, that's my cue to leave.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, you don't have to. I'm going to wear this cover.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.line: Still. Still.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You won't see-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [to Cece] You want a giraffe?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes, I am brining my kids in to help me get out of this hole. And you all remember my beautiful wife, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hi. Wow, I really thought I'd be more excited to be here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Whoa, whoa, whoa, game face, baby, game face.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh right, okay. Hey Stanley, it's great to see you!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Whoa, no, no. That's overdoing it, I think.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, hi Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Split the difference?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hi everybody!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: How about a little visit?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow, what a surprise. That's crazy. You guys get to meet the little heck-raisers.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Hey, Angela's back with her baby.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes, well, you guys all know Cece, but we wanted to introduce you to baby Philip.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Aw! You guys. He's licking on my finger, just like my cat does.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Let me have a turn.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, it's the pacifier's turn.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Did you say something about this one bringing in something for these people?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [gasps] Yes! Cece wanted to thank everybody for letting her daddy stay home with her all last week and play, so she brought you a little treat.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Cookies?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, but that would've been a really good idea.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That was a great idea.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, she brought you drawings.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh my goodness, let's take a look at these. They're usually amazing, so let's see. Yup, they are. Uncle Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, Aunt Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Wow, these are incredible. Cece, did you do these?

quotes.speaker: Cece
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: She says "no" to everything. You know, she thinks my name is "No." Cece, do you want some broccoli?

quotes.speaker: Cece
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No. It's crazy.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Why am I shorter than the table that I'm standing next to?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: There's cross-hatching in some of these. That's kind of advanced for a two-year-old.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Cece, this is your big sister Kelly. Did you color this pretty picture?

quotes.speaker: Cece
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: So then this means nothing to you. [rips picture]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey, Cece, why don't you draw another picture for us, exactly like this one, or at least in the exact same style?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know what? I don't think you need to do things on command. That's very weird. I'll just take that. Thank you. I think we should just wrap up the show, kiddos. Right?

quotes.speaker: Cece
quotes.line: [cries] Mama!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Shh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I don't know what else we can do here.

quotes.speaker: Cece
quotes.line: [cries] Mama, mama, mama.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It's okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, it's okay, sweetie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right, all right. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It's okay, honey. [Philip cries] It's okay, it's okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right, I know, I know. Let's just get this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Shh.

quotes.speaker: Cece
quotes.line: Mama!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Angela, this child is definitely mine. He looks just like me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Every baby looks just like you. Your face kind of looks like a baby.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Need I remind you that we were together a month before the wedding?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: That is completely untrue.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Completely true. Remember? Angela. No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You said that Robert was not fulfilling you-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I did not. Uh-uh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: -and I said, "I bet I could fulfill you," and you said, "I'd like to see you try," and then I kissed you with the force of a thousand waterfalls.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: That didn't happen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And then I inserted my penis-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No! Stop it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Into your-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Vagina and-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: And even if it did, it's just a coincidence.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Admit that there is a chance.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I will not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Admit it. Admit it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I will not, it's not-

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.line: All done?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.line: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Yes, yes. He's sleeping.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Before I go, may I?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Sure. [gives Philip to Dwight] Watch the head, watch the head.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Nurse, you know that baby in there, baby Philip? Cancel the circumcision.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.line: Who are you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I just might be his father.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.line: I don't know what that means. We're gonna circumcise him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Philip is crying] I know, buddy, I know. Cece, you want to come? Want to come out?

quotes.speaker: Cece
quotes.line: No!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh bud, I know. Do you have a pacifier or anything?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm looking, I'm looking for the pacifier.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Cece!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay, we're going.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, okay, we gotta go. All right, we're going home, we're going home. We're going home, we're going home. I know, I know, bud.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Shh, shh, shh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I know, I know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You want to grab her?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm gonna grab her, okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Here we go, here we go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hi, all right. I'm just going to go down to the car and I'm going to put her in her seat and I'll be right back up.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [groans] We'll see you tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, no, it's okay, I'll be right back.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: No, just go home.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: It's all good, we got this.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I have a kid. Last week, Jim at home? That was no vacation.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Jim.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Just go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey, we'll be just fine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Thanks guys. All right, here we go. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh, whew!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Dwight, what the hell? You can't smoke in here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, right. [sighs] The office looks different now. Huh. Smaller. Maybe I just feel bigger. Hello Gabe.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: You had something important to tell me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, you know, I did but now it seems infinitely insignificant.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim? Oh, right. Nah, forget it. He was doing it for his kids. I get it. Kids drive us dads crazy. Sometimes I feel like they're raising us. Am I right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I would love for everyone to just forgive me. But, if that's not happening, I'm not averse to just buying them all off.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright guys. You know how we all like the red licorice but it's always buried behind like a ton of black licorice? [points to pile of candy] Bought it all. Now it's like red city in there. So, enjoy it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Mmm-hmm. Moneybags. Must be nice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: So you effectively spent what...four dollars on the entire office?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Uh, I can't get a handle on it. Am I cheap or rich? I can't...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You're nothing. When I think about all the gas money I spent on you. Washing my car to make sure you-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [interrupting] Alright. Well, enjoy the red licorice, and good riddance, right? [tosses black licorice into trash]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Whoa whoa whoa whoa whoa! So you're just gonna throw away perfectly good food?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It's not really food, right?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I'm really hating this Jim guy!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ok, ok, ok.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I know what you can do Jim. Take those black licorice, then go get some of those red licorice, take 'em in your hand, roll 'em up real tight...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: “And shove it up my butt.”

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Dammit Jim! You stole my afternoons, now you stole my line! It's not “shove it up your butt” it's....I'll kill you! I'll kill you dead!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Eat it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm not gonna eat it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Eat. It.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm not-

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: EAT IT! [Jim begins eating black licorice]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [on phone] They hate me, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: They don't hate you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, it's bad. Darryl canceled go-karting....

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: When were you going go-karting with Darryl?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It's a lunch thing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Alright. Just don't worry, we'll figure this out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I feel like a stranger in my own country.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ok, drama.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ok. Well, hey, you're not here. You don't know, Ok? It's intense. They made me eat black licorice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I have a recurring nightmare that I've been wrongly accused of a crime and twelve of these idiots are on the jury. Stanley is fast asleep, Kevin eats the evidence, Phyllis's name is Allison but it really is Phyllis, Jim is foreman of the jury and pronounces me guilty. The cop takes me away and tells me that I've been a bad boy and we have sex in the hall. She leaves the handcuffs on. They take me away to prison. The guards are all women. [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Everyone, this is Officer Foley from the Scranton PD. Works down at the courthouse. I think he has something he's like to say.

quotes.speaker: Officer Foley
quotes.line: I understand that some of you don't believe that Mr. Bernard drove his friend into the courthouse for jury duty last week.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Correction: we don't care.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Hey, aren't you an actor?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Weren't you in Sweeny Todd last year with Andy?

quotes.speaker: Officer Foley
quotes.line: Uh, no.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: You hired your actor friend to come here as a cop?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That is so offensive and ridiculous. I-

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: So if I started singing “Down By the Old Mill Stream”, you couldn't join me in a three part harmony. [Andy and Officer Foley shake their heads no, Darryl begins singing] Down by the, down by the, down by the....

quotes.speaker: Andy, Darryl & Officer Foley
quotes.line: [singing] Old mill stream. When I first met you, down by the old mill stream [Andy & Foley hold “stream”]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: [Low singing] Old, mill, stream.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ho hah!....oh, shoot.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Mm hmm.
